summary: U.S. territories, like states, borrow through financial markets. We reviewed the territories' fiscal year 2005-2015 public debt. Puerto Rico 's debt grew to 66% of GDP and the territory is now in default. Its financial future is unclear until debt restructuring is complete. Guam 's debt increased to 44% of GDP. title: U.S. Territories: Public Debt Outlook
